div.p: From Robert Kerr to John Brooke
D61/2781, unit 77, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 1.4.93. To proof.
See also N. Bickford to C. Hodgkinson, 27 June 1861 (in this edition as M61-06-27).
In behalf of the Immigrant's Aid Society, I have the honor to apply for permission to turn out to graze, on the swamp formerly a Brick field, lying between the Yarra and the Immigrant's Home South East of Prince's Bridge, the Cows belonging to this Institution, four in number, and, a pony used principally to convey provisions to the Country for the sick children of the Institution. For some time past the Cows have been allowed to graze there, by permission of Dr Mueller, but the Crown Bailiff had informed me, it is necessary that your permission should be obtained.

I beg to state that the rough price of land referred to, in its present state is useless for any purpose, but for the one, for which the Society require it. It is separated from the other reserve, by a fence and there is not anything the Cows can damage [...]
Not relevant.

The Chief Commissioner of Land Occupation
The Commissioner of Crown Land and Survey.

&c&c&c
On 4 June 1861 C. Hodgkinson, Deputy Surveyor General, instructed: ' Mr Drummond Inform that the stock belonging to the Immigrants aid society can be depastured on the land in question pending its proclamation as a [...] common'.
